Events

We are passionate about software development. And we like to be part of the conversation.

Upcoming events

EXPERTALKS - Nov 2012 - Web Application Clustering

Pune India, 24 November 2012

Piyush Katariya will be conducting a workshop on Web Application Clustering.
Through this workshop, participants will learn how clustering addresses some of the most crucial demands of today’s ever-growing user base; including scalability and 24/7 availability amongst others.

The session would also touch upon areas like cluster types, load balancing algorithms and fault tolerance.

Find out more and register

Past events

  • CodeKen 2012

    Everywhere!, 06 November 2012 Jon Dickinson organised CodeKen 2012 an online social conference for passionate developers everywhere.

  • FP Days 2012 - Clojure after the honeymoon

    Cambridge, UK, 25 October 2012 Jon Pither and Hakan Raberg present their experiences using Clojure in banking

  • MongoDB Pune 2012

    Pune, India, 21 October 2012 Vishwas Bhagath explained how and why Equal Experts used MongoDB to deliver the new O2 Accessories shop.

  • EXPERTALKS - Oct 2012 - Code Retreat.

    Pune India, 06 October 2012 The Code Retreat provided a great opportunity for participants to learn and implement best programming practices. By applying fundamental principles of OOP & TDD, participants were able to evolve an elegant solution for the given domain modeling exercise.

  • EXPERTALKS - July 2012 - Build using Gradle

    Pune India, 28 July 2012 This workshop explored how to use Gradle to automate the build process.

  • MongoDB UK 2012

    London, 20 June 2012 MongoDB UK is an annual one day conference dedicated to the open source database MongoDB.

  • Experiences from a Real-World Scala Project

    London, 13 June 2012 Chris Turner presents an experience report of delivering a real-world Scala project.
    Checkout the meetup

  • MongoDB London User Group - EE Takeover!

    London, 29 May 2012 Three awesome lightning talks by three passionate EE devs. Checkout the event

  • Total Massacre - Reducing the middle office

    London, 24 May 2012 EuroClojure is the first 2-day, full-blown conference in Europe for the Clojure community. Jon Pither and Hakan Raberg are presenting a talk on their experience of introducing Clojure to investment banking. Euro Clojure 2012

  • Non-Rails Groovy Development

    London, 16 May 2012 Sean Reilly discussed the internals of a recent project that was developed with Groovy, Jersey and MongoDB to develop a powerful enterprise REST API.

  • Real Time Analytics with MongoDB

    Slough, 25 April 2012 Julian Browne presents Real Time Analytics with MongoDB and Chris Tarttelin talks about Schema Design and how it is implemented at O2.
    Checkout the meetup group

  • How to make a difference

    Southampton, 23 April 2012 Plamen Balkanski presented 'How to make a difference' at the Agile South Coast meetup group.

  • EXPERTALKS - Apr 2012 - Continuous Integration (C.I) using Jenkins.

    Pune India, 21 April 2012 This workshop illustrated the importance of Continuous Integration (C.I) on Agile projects. Participants learned how to implement C.I on a live project using the Jenkins tool.

  • NOSQL and the Effects of Big Data

    London, 12 April 2012 Lightning talks covering an overview of the NOSQL landscape, an introduction to Hadoop and the effects of processing large amounts of data on the environment.
    Checkout the meetup group

  • User Centred Scenarios - Describing capabilities, not solutions

    London, 04 April 2012 James Martin and Antony Marcano extoll the virtues of describing the required capabilities of a system over solutions.

  • First DeNormalised Meetup

    London, 20 March 2012 Lightning talks covering machine learning, geospatial search with MongoDB and the new MongoDB aggregation framework.
    Checkout the meetup group

  • EXPERTALKS - Mar 2012 - BDD extends TDD

    Pune India, 17 March 2012 This workshop explored how to use Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) to evolve the design of your software. BDD aims to bridge the gap between the different stakeholders on a project (Product Owner, BA, QA and Developer) to uniquely define the behavior of the software.

  • How would you say that? Effective conversations for change with Agile

    London, 08 March 2012 How do you handle situations where adopting Agile approaches doesn't work as planned? This interactive session provided an opportunity to discuss challenging situations and practice some practical suggestions for how to have more effective conversations.
    Conference site

  • EXPERTALKS - Feb 2012 - TDD As It's Meant To Be

    Pune India, 18 February 2012 This workshop explored how to use unit tests in conjunction with mock objects and inversion of control to drive the design of the code.

  • Agile India 2012

    Bangalore India, 17 February 2012 Agile Software Community of India presented Asia's largest international conference on Agile and Lean Software Development methods. Equal Experts is a proud sponsor of Agile India 2012.
    Conference site

  • JSFoo 2012

    Pune India, 21 January 2012 Anil Tarte of Equal Experts demonstrated behaviour and test-driven development to incrementally build rich internet applications with Javascript.
    More details

  • EXPERTALKS - Jan 2012 - APPLYING TDD & BDD TO IMPLEMENT RICH INTERNET APPLICATIONS

    Pune India, 14 January 2012 Equal Experts India conceived EXPERTALKS; a monthly technical workshop focused on emerging practices, trends and technologies in software. EXPERTALKS â€“ Jan 12 demonstrated how TDD & BDD can be applied while writing object oriented JavaScript code. Using a real world trading application for the workshop, participants learned how to apply Agile practices for developing rich internet applications.

  • OIPD Conference

    London, 15 December 2011 Equal Experts presented a number of talks at the first OIPD Conference in London.
